block.p: Dulcie Lin, a daughter of Christine and Ming Lin of Parsippany, N.J., and Jock Tsungkan Jones, the son of Chantal K. Jones and Lewis R. Jones of Rockford, Ill., were married last evening. The Rev. Richard Horn, a Lutheran minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony at the Manor, a restaurant in West Orange, N.J.

Ms. Lin, 25, will continue to use her name professionally. She is an associate in the pension services group at Goldman, Sachs & Company, where she helps manage institutional accounts. She graduated from Columbia University. Her father worked until last February as an information systems executive in Guangzhou, China, for the American International Group, the insurance company. Her mother is an independent real estate broker in Parsippany, N.J.

Dulcie Lin, a daughter of Christine and Ming Lin of Parsippany, N.J., and Jock Tsungkan Jones, the son of Chantal K. Jones and Lewis R. Jones of Rockford, Ill., were married last evening. The Rev. Richard Horn, a Lutheran minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony at the Manor, a restaurant in West Orange, N.J.

Ms. Lin, 25, will continue to use her name professionally. She is an associate in the pension services group at Goldman, Sachs & Company, where she helps manage institutional accounts. She graduated from Columbia University. Her father worked until last February as an information systems executive in Guangzhou, China, for the American International Group, the insurance company. Her mother is an independent real estate broker in Parsippany, N.J.

The bridegroom, 26, is a trader at Lehman Brothers in New York. He graduated from Massachusetts Institute of Technology. His father is a senior vice president and an investment manager at Amcore Financial, a bank-holding company in Rockford. The bridegroom's mother is a senior rate specialist, determining energy prices for Commonwealth Edison, an electric utility company in Chicago.
